ext2

Class INode

  • java.lang.Object
    • ext2.DataBlock
      • ext2.INode

  • public class INode
extends DataBlock
    Name: iNode This class represents an iNode in the filesystem. Every file can be located by it's respective iNode and contains metadata about the file. The iNode contains pointers to the blocks which are represented by the iNode.
    See Also:
    DataBlock

    • Constructor Detail

      • INode

        public INode(int iNodeNumber,
             int iNodeTblPointer,
             int groupNum,
             SuperBlock superBlock)
        Constructor to initialise an iNode with the relevant fields.
        Parameters:
        iNodeNumber - The number of this iNode.
        iNodeTblPointer - The pointer to the iNode table in which this iNode belongs.
        groupNum - The group the iNode belongs to.
        superBlock - The reference to the super block for file system information.

    • Method Detail

      • getDataBlocksFromPointers

        public byte[] getDataBlocksFromPointers()
        Retrieves an array of bytes referenced by the direct pointers in this iNode. If the indirection pointer fields are not empty, a recursive method is called to obtain data block pointers.
        Returns:
        Array of bytes for the data blocks being pointed to.

      • getFileModeAsString

        public java.lang.String getFileModeAsString()
        Retrieves the file mode field for the iNode and returns a string representation. Used in Unix-like directory listings, displaying permissions, directory info etc.
        Returns:
        String representation of the file mode.

      • getFileMode

        public short getFileMode()
        Retrieves the file mode for the given iNode as a string.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the file mode.

      • getUserID

        public short getUserID()
        Retrieves the lower 16 bits of the user ID of the owner.
        Returns:
        The user ID.

      • getLowerFileSize

        public int getLowerFileSize()
        Retrieves the lower 32 bits of the file size, in bytes.
        Returns:
        Lower 32 bit size of file in bytes.

        public java.lang.String getLastAccessTime()

      • getIndirectPointer

        public int getIndirectPointer()
        Retrieves the 4-byte integer indirect data block pointer from the iNode.
        Returns:
        The single-indirect data block pointer.

        Returns:

      • getTotalFileSize

        public long getTotalFileSize()
        Combines the upper and lower 32 bit file sizes into 1 64 bit file size.
        Returns:
        The size of the file referenced by this iNode.
